project_descr: Institutional mechanisms for integrated environmental management strengthened and operational

outputs.output_title: Support to Ozone Cell for MP
outputs.output_descr: The project will contribute to promotion of sustainable development and alleviation of poverty in Pakistan through provision of timely environmental information
Institutional Strengthening for the Implementation of Montreal Protocol - Phase IX
Phase-out of CFC consumption in the Manufacture of MDIs in Pakistan. Phase-out of CFC consumption in the Manufacture of Metered Dose Inhalers in Pakistan.

The Joint Programme on Environment (JPE) will bring 11 UN agencies together to work with relevant Government counterparts including the Ministries of Environment, Local Government and Rural Development, Industries, Science and Technology, Environment Protection Agencies at the Federal, provincial and district levels, NGOs and the private sector. The JPE is in line with and contributes to the UNDAF and key national policies and priorities relating to the environment. It also supports Pakistan in fulfilling its international obligations towards environmental treaties and agreements (such as: Goa
donor_name: UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT

outputs.output_descr: 1. Comprehensive analysis of existing situation of environmental information in Pakistan. 2. Datasets, indicators and indices for monitoring the state of the environment finalized in consultation with stakeholders. 3. Appropriate institutional and technical framework for NEIMS Pakistan is established. 4. Development of database relating to various sectors of environment and inter-sectoral existing database of environmental information in the country and their networking supported by GIS and remote sensing. 5.
